wikitext.*:
'''Jude Fisher''' is a pseudonym used by the English science-fiction and fantasy novelist '''Jane Johnson'''.

==Life==
From [[1984]] to [[1992]], Johnson was the Publisher of the [[J.R.R. Tolkien|Tolkien]] list at [[Allen and Unwin]], [[Unwin Hyman]] and [[HarperCollins]]. Her main task was commissioning artists like [[Alan Lee]], [[John Howe]] and [[Ted Nasmith]] for calendars and book art. During the production of [[The Lord of the Rings (film series)|''The Lord of the Rings'' (film series)]], she spent much time in [[New Zealand]] with the cast and crew, and produced several books about the films. 

After a near-fatal accident, she went to live in Morocco, but she still serves as [[HarperCollins]]' Fiction Publishing Director.
